executable.title: BRAINSResample
executable.description: This program resamples an image image using a deformation field or a linear transform.
executable.contributor: This tool was developed by Vincent Magnotta, Greg Harris, and Hans Johnson.

parameters.label: Input Image Files
parameters.description: Parameters for specifying the deformation field, image to warp and resulting image space

image.name: referenceVolume
image.description: Reference image defining the output space
image.label: Reference Image

parameters.label: Warping Parameters
parameters.description: Parameters used to define home the image is warped

file.name: warpTransform
file.label: Warp By Transform
file.description: Filename for the BRAINSFit transform used in place of the deformation field

string-enumeration.name: pixelType
string-enumeration.label: Pixel Type
string-enumeration.description: Specifies the pixel type for the input/output images. The "binary" pixel type uses a modified algorithm whereby the image is read in as unsigned char, a signed distance map is created, signed distance map is resampled, and then a thresholded image of type unsigned char is written to disk.

boolean.name: invertTransform
boolean.label: Invert Linear Transform flag
boolean.description: Perform transform inversion in itk physical space before applying the linear transform to the image.

boolean.name: addGrids
boolean.label: Add warped grid to output image
boolean.description: Add warped grid to output image.

parameters.label: Invalid Parameters
parameters.description: These parameters just give an innocuous warning.

string.name: useTransformMode
string.label: Explicit Transform Kind in Use
string.description: This defunct parameter is no longer in service. Now ApplyWarp infers the transform type from the contents of the .mat file.
